required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dispensing Study for a New Study Test Lens
clinical_study.official_title: Dispensing Study for a New Study Test Lens

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate performance criteria over one week of daily wear to determine if the Study Test contact lens performs equivalently to the comfilcon A contact lenses in terms of measurement and subjective ratings of visual performance.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, single site, daily wear, double masked, randomized bilateral cross over dispensing study of binocular wear of Study Test Lens and comfilcon A sphere contact lenses over 1 week of daily wear. Assessments will be obtained upon dispensing each lens pair and following 1 week of daily lens use.

primary_outcome.measure: Distance Visual Acuity (VA) - High Contrast (HC) - Study Test Lens
primary_outcome.description: logMAR (Logarithm of the Minimum Angle of Resolution) VA (Visual Acuity)

primary_outcome.measure: Distance Visual Acuity (VA) - High Contrast (HC) - comfilcon A
Near Visual Acuity (VA) - High Contrast (HC) - Study Test Lens
Near Visual Acuity (VA) - High Contrast (HC) - comfilcon A
Distance Visual Acuity (VA) - Low Contrast (LC) - Study Test Lens
Distance Visual Acuity (VA) - Low Contrast (LC) - comfilcon A
Near Visual Acuity (VA) - Low Contrast (LC) - Study Test Lens
Near Visual Acuity (VA) - Low Contrast (LC) - comfilcon A
Quality of Vision - Distance - Study Test Lens
primary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale: 0=extremely poor vision all of the time. 100=excellent vision all of the time

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of Vision - Distance - comfilcon A
primary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale: 0=extremely poor vision all of the time. 100=excellent vision all of the time

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of Vision - Near - Study Test Lens
primary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale: 0=extremely poor vision all of the time. 100=excellent vision all of the time

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of Vision - Near - comfilcon A
primary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale: 0=extremely poor vision all of the time. 100=excellent vision all of the time

primary_outcome.measure: High Illumination High Contrast (HIHC) Visual Acuity - Study Test Lens
primary_outcome.description: High Illumination High Contrast (HICH) Visual Acuity assessed for OD, OS, and OU using logMAR VA

primary_outcome.measure: High Illumination High Contrast (HIHC) Visual Acuity - comfilcon A
primary_outcome.description: High Illumination High Contrast (HICH) Visual Acuity assessed for OD, OS, and OU using logMAR VA

primary_outcome.measure: Low Illumination High Contrast (LIHC) Visual Acuity - Study Test Lens
primary_outcome.description: Low Illumination High Contrast (LIHC) Visual Acuity assessed for OD, OS, and OU using logMAR VA

primary_outcome.measure: Low Illumination High Contrast (LIHC) Visual Acuity - comfilcon A
primary_outcome.description: Low Illumination High Contrast (LIHC) Visual Acuity assessed for OD, OS, and OU using logMAR VA

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Bulbar & Limbal Hyperaemia - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 week follow-up visit, 2 week follow-up visit
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: (0=None, 1= Slight injection to conjunctival vessels, 2= Mild injection, 3= Moderate injection, 4= Severe injection) in (0.25 steps)

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Bulbar & Limbal Hyperaemia - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: (0=None, 1= Slight injection to conjunctival vessels, 2= Mild injection, 3= Moderate injection, 4= Severe injection) in (0.25 steps)

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Palpebral Hyperaemia - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: (0=None, 1= Slight injection to conjunctival vessels, 2= Mild injection, 3= Moderate injection, 4= Severe injection) in (0.25 steps)

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Palpebral Hyperaemia - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: (0=None, 1= Slight injection to conjunctival vessels, 2= Mild injection, 3= Moderate injection, 4= Severe injection) in (0.25 steps)

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Palpebral Roughness - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: 0=Uniform satin appearance of conjunctiva, 1=Trace, slight loss of smoothness, 2=Mild, or scattered papillae/follicles <1mm in diameter, 3=Moderate, significant papillae/follicles <1mm in diameter, 4=Severe, localised or generalised papillae/ follicles 1mm or more in diameter) in 0.25 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Palpebral Roughness - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: 0=Uniform satin appearance of conjunctiva, 1=Trace, slight loss of smoothness, 2=Mild, or scattered papillae/follicles <1mm in diameter, 3=Moderate, significant papillae/follicles <1mm in diameter, 4=Severe, localised or generalised papillae/ follicles 1mm or more in diameter) in 0.25 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Other significant findings - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 4 categories: (1=Trace, 2=Mild, 3=Moderate, 4=Severe) in 0.25 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Other significant findings - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 4 categories: (1=Trace, 2=Mild, 3=Moderate, 4=Severe) in 0.25 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Corneal Staining Type - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: 0=No staining, 1=Trace, minimal superficial diffuse staining or stippling, or trace abrasion or foreign body tracks, 2=Mild, regional or diffuse punctate staining, or mild abrasion or foreign body tracks, 3=Moderate, significant dense coalesced staining, corneal abrasion or foreign body tracks, 4=Severe abrasions greater than 2mm diameter, ulcerations, epithelial loss, or full thickness abrasion in 0.50 steps.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Corneal Staining Type - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: 0=No staining, 1=Trace, minimal superficial diffuse staining or stippling, or trace abrasion or foreign body tracks, 2=Mild, regional or diffuse punctate staining, or mild abrasion or foreign body tracks, 3=Moderate, significant dense coalesced staining, corneal abrasion or foreign body tracks, 4=Severe abrasions greater than 2mm diameter, ulcerations, epithelial loss, or full thickness abrasion in 0.50 steps.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Corneal Staining Extent - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: 0=No staining, 1=1-15% of area, 2=16-30% of area, 3=31-45% of area, 4= >45% of area, using integer scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Corneal Staining Extent - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: 0=No staining, 1=1-15% of area, 2=16-30% of area, 3=31-45% of area, 4= >45% of area, using integer scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Causes for Staining - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of cornea as a whole: Dehydration staining present (yes/no), Lens related staining (yes/no), Toxic staining (yes/no), Other description

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Causes for Staining - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of cornea as a whole: Dehydration staining present (yes/no), Lens related staining (yes/no), Toxic staining (yes/no), Other description

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Corneal Staining Depth - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: 0=No staining, 1=Superficial epithelium, 2=Deep epithelium, delayed stromal glow, 3=Immediate localized stromal glow, 4=Immediate diffuse stromal glow, or full thickness abrasion in 0.50 steps.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Corneal Staining Depth - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: 0=No staining, 1=Superficial epithelium, 2=Deep epithelium, delayed stromal glow, 3=Immediate localized stromal glow, 4=Immediate diffuse stromal glow, or full thickness abrasion in 0.50 steps.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Conjunctival Staining - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: 0=None, 1=Minimal diffuse punctate, 2=Coalescent punctate, 3=Confluent, 4=Deep confluent in 0.50 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Conjunctival Staining - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories: 0=None, 1=Minimal diffuse punctate, 2=Coalescent punctate, 3=Confluent, 4=Deep confluent in 0.50 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomicroscopy - Conjunctival Indentation - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 categories:0 None, 1=Very slight, 2=Slight, 3=Moderate, 4=Severe in 0.50 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Centration - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using Grading Categories: Optimally Centered, Slightly Decentered (<0.5mm) Nasal, Temporal, Superior, Inferior (NTSI), Extremely Decentered (>0.5mm) NTSI

secondary_outcome.measure: Centration - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using Grading Categories: Optimally Centered, Slightly Decentered (<0.5mm) Nasal, Temporal, Superior, Inferior (NTSI), Extremely Decentered (>0.5mm) NTSI

secondary_outcome.measure: Post Blink Movement - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of Amount of movement (to the nearest 0.1mm) immediately after the blink (0.1mm steps)

secondary_outcome.measure: Post Blink Movement - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of Amount of movement (to the nearest 0.1mm) immediately after the blink (0.1mm steps)

secondary_outcome.measure: Push - Up Test - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using Continuous Scale 0-100% (1% steps): 0%=Falls from cornea without lid support, 50%=Optimum, 100%=No movement

secondary_outcome.measure: Push - Up Test - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using Continuous Scale 0-100% (1% steps): 0%=Falls from cornea without lid support, 50%=Optimum, 100%=No movement

secondary_outcome.measure: Mobility Rating - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 Categories in 0.50 steps: 0=Immobile - no lag in any versions, 1=Restricted - no lag in some directions but slight lag (0-0.25mm) in others, 2=Secure - slight lag (0.25-0.5mm in each version), 3=Unrestricted - freely lags in a controlled manner on all versions, but not excessive (0.5-1.0mm), 4=Very mobile - excessive lag (>1mm) on versions in all directions in 0.25 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Mobility Rating - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 Categories in 0.50 steps: 0=Immobile - no lag in any versions, 1=Restricted - no lag in some directions but slight lag (0-0.25mm) in others, 2=Secure - slight lag (0.25-0.5mm in each version), 3=Unrestricted - freely lags in a controlled manner on all versions, but not excessive (0.5-1.0mm), 4=Very mobile - excessive lag (>1mm) on versions in all directions in 0.25 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Lens Fit Acceptance - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 Categories in 0.25 steps: 0=Can't be worn, 1=Poor - should not be dispensed although no immediate danger, 2=Fair, 3=Good, 4=Optimum in 0.25 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Lens Fit Acceptance - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 Categories in 0.25 steps: 0=Can't be worn,, 1=Poor - should not be dispensed although no immediate danger, 2=Fair, 3=Good, 4=Optimum in 0.25 steps

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Surface Quality - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 Categories in 0.25 steps: 0=Very Poor; 1=Poor; 2=Acceptable; 3=Good; 4=Excellent

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Surface Quality - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 Categories in 0.25 steps: 0= Very poor; 1=Poor; 2=Acceptable; 3=Good; 4=Excellent

secondary_outcome.measure: Front Surface Deposits - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 Categories in 0.25 steps:0=Clean, no deposits, 1=5 or less small deposits (<0.1mm), 2=>5 deposits of <0.1mm size or film covering 25-50% of surface, 3=Deposits of between 0.1 and 0.5mm or film covering 50-75% of surface, 4=Deposits of 0.5mm or larger or film covering more than 75% of surface

secondary_outcome.measure: Front Surface Deposits - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment using 5 Categories in 0.25 steps:0=Clean, no deposits, 1=5 or less small deposits (<0.1mm), 2=>5 deposits of <0.1mm size or film covering 25-50% of surface, 3=Deposits of between 0.1 and 0.5mm or film covering 50-75% of surface, 4=Deposits of 0.5mm or larger or film covering more than 75% of surface

secondary_outcome.measure: Deposit Type - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Grade type of deposits using 4 categories (integer): 1=lipid, 2= mucous, 3=protein, 4=other)

secondary_outcome.measure: Deposit Type - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Grade type of deposits using 4 categories (integer): 1=lipid, 2= mucous, 3=protein, 4=other)

secondary_outcome.measure: Back Surface Debris - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Grade amount of back surface debris trapped between lens and cornea in 0.25 steps using 5 categories: 0=No debris small (<0.1mm) particles Coalescing areas <1/3 of lens area Coalescing areas between 1/3 to 2/3 of area beneath lens Debris under lens >2/3 area

secondary_outcome.measure: Back Surface Debris - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Grade amount of back surface debris trapped between lens and cornea in 0.25 steps using 5 categories: 0=No debris small (<0.1mm) particles Coalescing areas <1/3 of lens area Coalescing areas between 1/3 to 2/3 of area beneath lens Debris under lens >2/3 area

secondary_outcome.measure: Ghosting - Distance Vision - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale:0=Intolerable;100=Not noticable

secondary_outcome.measure: Ghosting - Distance Vision - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale:0=Intolerable;100=Not noticable

secondary_outcome.measure: Ghosting when reading - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale:0=Intolerable;100=Not noticable

secondary_outcome.measure: Ghosting when reading - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale:0=Intolerable;100=Not noticable

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Comfort - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,1 week follow-up visit, 2 week follow-up visit
secondary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale, 0= cannot be worn, 100= cannot be felt ever.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Comfort - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,1 week follow-up visit, 2 week follow-up visit
secondary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale, 0= cannot be worn, 100= cannot be felt ever.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Dryness - Study Test Lens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,1 week follow-up visit, 2 week follow-up visit
secondary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale, 0=cannot be worn, 100=no dryness experienced at any time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Dryness - comfilcon A
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,1 week follow-up visit, 2 week follow-up visit
secondary_outcome.description: Patient subjective scoring using 0-100 continuous scale, 0=cannot be worn, 100=no dryness experienced at any time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Preference - Distance Vision
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective rating for lens preference for distance vision assessed at 2 week follow-up visit. (Study test lens or comfilcon A)

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Preference - Digital device overall preference
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective rating of lens preference for digital device overall preference assessed at 2 week follow-up visit. (Study test lens or comfilcon A)

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Preference - Tired eyes relief preference
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective rating of lens preference for tired eyes relief preference assessed at 2 week follow-up visit. (Study test lens or comfilcon A)

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Preference - Overall Vision Preference
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective rating of lens preference for overall vision preference assessed at 2 week follow-up visit. (Study test lens or comfilcon A)

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Preference - Comfort Preference
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective rating of lens preference for comfort preference assessed at 2 week follow-up visit. (Study test lens or comfilcon A)

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Preference - Overall Lens Preference
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective rating of lens preference for over lens preference assessed at 2 week follow-up visit. (Study test lens or comfilcon A)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
A person is eligible for inclusion in the study if he/she:
- A person is eligible for inclusion in the study if he/she:
- Oculo-visual examination in the last two years
- Between 18 and 35 years of age and has full legal capacity to volunteer
- Has read and understood the informed consent letter
- Is willing and able to follow instructions and maintain the appointment schedule
- Is correctable to a visual acuity of 20/25 or better (in each eye) with their habitual correction or 20/20 best corrected
- Currently wears, or has previously successfully worn, soft contact lenses between -1.00D (Diopoter) and -4.00D
- Spherical Contact Lens Rx between -1.00 and -4.00 and spectacle cylinder <-0.75
- Has not worn lenses for at least 12 hours before the initial visit
- Has a subjective response at baseline, which indicates suitability for this study
- Currently spends a minimum of 4 hours a day; 5 days a week on digital devices and can replicate this time during the study period
- Is willing and able to wear the study contact lenses a minimum of 10 hours per day; 5 days a week
Exclusion Criteria:
A person will be excluded from the study if he/she:
•• Has never worn contact lenses before
- Any systemic disease affecting ocular health
- Is using any systemic or topical medications that will affect ocular health
- Has known sensitivity to the diagnostic pharmaceuticals or study products used in this study.
- Has any ocular pathology or anomaly that would affect the wearing of the lenses
- Has persistent, clinically significant corneal or conjunctival staining using sodium fluorescein dye
- Is aphakic
- Has anisometropia of >1.00
- Has undergone corneal refractive surgery
- Has strabismus
- Has any ocular amblyopia >= 1line of HC (High Contrast) Visual Acuity
- Is participating in any other type of eye related clinical or research study

facility.name: Center for Contact Lens Research, University of Waterloo
